properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 2 at 8:23PM MST until February 3 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
A winter storm system will bring snow to northeastern Wyoming
and the Black Hills area tonight through Monday. Snow amounts of
greater than 6 inches are expected across parts of the
northeastern Wyoming plains, the Bear Lodge Mountains, and the
northern to central Black Hills. Forecast snow amounts taper off
fairly quickly from the foothills of the Black Hills to the
adjacent plains of southwestern South Dakota. Snow will increase
in coverage this evening and will continue through Monday
morning. The snow will gradually decrease on Monday afternoon,
but could linger across parts of the northeastern Wyoming plains
and far southwestern South Dakota into Monday evening.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6
inches, with locally higher amounts possible across the higher
foothills.

* WHERE...The Sturgis/Piedmont Foot Hills and the Northern Foot
Hills.

* WHEN...Until 6 PM MST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST MONDAY
